item.title: Wallet Security, Key Management & HSMs
item.description: Wallet Security, Key Management & Hardware Security Modules (HSMs) https://twitter.com/kanzure/status/1049813559750746112 Dev++ / BC2 - October 4th-5th 2018 - Keio University, Tokyo, Japan https://bitcoinedge.org/event/keio-devplusplus-2018 schedule: https://keio-devplusplus-2018.bitcoinedge.org/#schedule Intro Alright, I’m now going to talk about bitcoin wallet security. And I was asked to talk about key management and hardware security modules and a bunch of other topics all in one talk. This will be a bit broader than some of the other talks because this is an important subject about how do you actually store bitcoin and then some of the developments around the actual storage of bitcoin in a secure way.

item.title: Handling Reorgs & Forks
item.description: https://twitter.com/kanzure/status/1052344700554960896 Dev++ / BC2 - October 4th-5th 2018 - Keio University, Tokyo, Japan https://bitcoinedge.org/event/keio-devplusplus-2018 schedule: https://keio-devplusplus-2018.bitcoinedge.org/#schedule Introduction Good morning, my name is Bryan. I’m going to be talking about reorganizations and forks in the bitcoin blockchain. First, I want to define what a reorganization is and what a fork is. Definitions You might have heard that the bitcoin blockchain is a permanent data structure that records everything from all time and that is actually somewhat false.
